content: One of the most controversial issues in U.S. foreign assistance is restrictions on funding for abortion and family planning activities abroad. The debate revolves around whether recipients of U.S. aid perform abortions or coercive sterilization with U.S. funds, and the impact of withholding funds on population growth and reproductive health services in developing countries.
